intro: Psychotria collicola, commonly known as the "Columbian psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain bird species. Psychotria collicola is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
